name: Kokuleket 2
description:
Description:

This is the sequel to the original Kokuleket desktop platformer/breakout game released in 2002 by James Fajardo.

In Kokuleket 2, we learn that the first game's protagonist (your father) has been stuck in the game for twenty years with no way out. The unseen curator of this realm unleashes a collection of elegant albeit toxic butterflies—you can look but don't touch! If you're particularly unfortunate, you might encounter two macro-sized bees turned decadent from a prolonged lack of natural or artificial threats in their carefully monitored vivarium. In short, they don't know how to respond to visitors. There's also some wanderer that calls this place "home," but we don't like to talk about him...

Gather the seven orbs, play a few mini-games (pong, slots, breakout), and save your long-lost father from the Kokuleket realm.

This game was completed over the course of one week and submitted for the 2022 PongJam (Hosted by Scott Melanson), celebrating 50 years of the classic game PONG. #pongjam

Note: If the game pauses, try clicking in the canvas to start/resume game.

Player 1:
  • Left: A
  • Up: W
  • Right: D
  • Level Restart: V
Player 2 (Pong matches):
  • Left: J
  • Up: I   
  • Right: L
Features:
  • 6 puzzle-platformer levels
  • 2 Pong-styled minigames
  • 1 slots machine minigame
  • 1 breakout minigame
  • ~1 hour of gameplay
Credits:

Game Design and Artwork: Tyler Wright

Programming: Dylan Wright

Beta Testing: Dyani Wright

Music:

“Lobby” by Dylan Wright

“Realm” and “Nostalgia Heart” by Tyler Wright; Produced by Filthy Kleen Productions (2007)

“Pineapple Rag” composed by Scott Joplin
